trial_identification.studytitle: The Active-Team Program - a social networking physical activity intervention for inactive adults delivered via a Facebook application.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: An online social networking physical activity intervention for inactive adults delivered via a Facebook application: an RCT.

interventions.interventions: 50-day team-based social-network-based physical activity intervention. Delivered via a Facebook application and iPhone counterpart, the Active-Team application, or A-Team for short, ultimately aims to improve the health and well-being of the South Australian community. Facebook users will use the A-Team app to invite 3-7 friends from their existing Facebook friend network to join their team. Participants will receive a pedometer, and be encouraged to take 10,000 steps per day for the 50 day challenge. The A-Team apps will provide daily humorous tips for physical activity, and allows participants to log their daily steps, see their teams tally board, send virtual gifts, unlock virtual awards and communicate via a wall.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Self-reported physical activity assessed by a daily exercise log of number of steps as measured by pedometer

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Quality of life and social support assessed by the AQoL-6D.
Quality of life and social support assessed by the Physical Activity Social Support Scale.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Facebook user, physically inactive (participant self nominates as undertaking less than 150 minutes a week of moderate to vigorous physical activity in the past month).
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Medical condition preventing increase in activity levels.

fundingsource.fundingname: Catalyst Research Grant, Department of Further Education, Employment, Science and Technology
fundingsource.fundingaddress: Level 4, 11 Waymouth Street Adelaide South Australia, 5000

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Online social-networking has tremendous reach and high engagement - innovative research is needed to harness this for public health gain. We aim to develop and evaluate a 50-day team-based social-network-based physical activity intervention. Delivered via a Facebook application and iPhone counterpart, the Active-Team application, or A-Team for short, ultimately aims to improve the health and well-being of the South Australian community.
